results.title: Early social behaviour
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Yale Clinic of Child Development
results.brief_description: Shows the manifestation of the infant personality in a variety of social settings. Ten different children from 8 weeks to 7 years of age are studied and individual differences are emphasised. Also the social significance of the household is conveyed by scenes that reflect parent-child relationships.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arnold Gesell, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Yale Clinic of Child Development

results.title: Early recognition of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Robert Anderson, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Contemporary Films and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Early marriage
results.brief_description: Deals with teenage marriage, high school counselling and classroom teaching of marriage preparation. Failures are often due to parents and schools making young marriages difficult, rather than ensuring their success. Discusses types of marriage, religious and civil. Symbolism of the ring and post nuptial ceremonies, which should demonstrate the approval and support of parents and friends.

results.title: Early interactions (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Philps, Victor Lockwood, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
H.R. Schaffer introduces five experiments which demonstrate the importance of synchronisation between mother and baby. The experiments also show that it is often the baby who initiates the interactions.

results.title: Early actualities [Silent]
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of early short silent films made between 1900-1905 about newsworthy events. Each “short” is preceded by explanatory titles as follows: THE BOER WAR: DEPARTURE OF THE GORDON HIGHLANDERS (OCT. 1899); LORD ROBERTS ARRIVES IN CAPE TOWN (JAN.1900); STREET SCENE IN LEEDS (C.1903); SCENE ON BRIGHTON PIER (C.1898); FIRE BRIGADE SCENE IN BRITAIN, FRANCE AND U.S.A. (C.1896-1902); FUNERAL OF QUEEN VICTORIA (FEB.1901).

results.title: Earliest times to 1066
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English History”.
This film discusses the building of Anglo-Saxon England, with emphasis on the many different peoples and cultures which contribute to the development of the English nation. This film uses authentic landmarks and historical material from 1900 B.C. to 1000 A.D. as well as brief re-enactments of important historical events to give a compressed picture of England and its people before the Norman Conquest.

results.title: Each day that comes
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A glimpse into the nature of loneliness. Frances Hyland plays the part of a small-town girl who enjoys position and respect in her community as the owner of a successful dress shop, but who wonders if marriage might not have been a better choice. Disturbed by thoughts of what might have been, she resolves to live each day as it comes. (Award: Melbourne) Cast includes: Frances Hyland, William Needles and Kate Reid

results.title: Each child is different
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Dramatised incidents are used in presenting a study of five fifth-grade children, whose personalities and backgrounds present typical problems. The film explains the importance of the elementary school teacher’s knowledge of the complex and different backgrounds of the children, as well as their individual abilities and needs, in order to adjust the teaching program to meet these needs.

results.title: Dutch oven cooking
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic principles of fire building and Dutch oven cooking for hikers and campers. Emphasizes the care and precision which must be exercised when sharpening and using axes and knives; demonstrates the correct methods for chopping wood. Describes, step by step, the procedure for making a batch of biscuits including the preparation of the Dutch oven for baking.
